title: Trump chooses top economic aide for vacant Fed seat
subhead: Stephen Miran, who holds a PhD in economics from Harvard and has advocated in favor of tariffs, will finish out the term of Adriana Kugler, an appointee of former president Joe Biden who announced her resignation last week. Trump said he is filling the spot temporarily as he looks for a 'permanent replacement.'

title: The advantage of tiny lemurs as research subjects
subhead: An international team has dissected four gray mouse lemurs and has created an atlas of their cells. Certain similarities with human cells could prove useful for biomedical research.

title: How Lake Chad became neglected by international aid
subhead: 'Lake Chad's Troubled Waters' (3/4). After a surge of solidarity in response to the attacks by Boko Haram, global attention has shifted away from the region. As NGOs have been weakened by the halt in US funding, the humanitarian situation remains dire.
byline: By Carol Valade (Lac province (Chad), special corresponden[)

title: Mojgan Habibi, chef: 'Before, I was afraid of everything. Now, I have found my freedom'
subhead: 'Refuge Recipes' (4/6). Iranian native Mojgan Habibi is the breakfast chef at Hôtel du Couvent in Nice. Khoresht mast, a dish reserved for special occasions and made with yogurt, spices, honey and meat, brings back memories of her happy youth in Isfahan before her marriage, when she was free to create and sing.

title: The calculated return of Kamala Harris after defeat and months of silence
subhead: The former US vice president announced the release of a memoir, '107 Days,' out September 23, revealing the behind-the-scenes from her presidential campaign. Harris, who appeared Thursday on Stephen Colbert's 'The Late Show' on CBS, has remained vague, however, about the future of her political involvement.
byline: By Corine Lesnes (San Francisco (United States) correspondent)
